noBarrelFile.description:
Description

Disallow the use of barrel file.
A barrel file is a file that re-exports all of the exports from other files in a directory.
This structure results in the unnecessary loading of many modules, significantly impacting performance in large-scale applications.
Additionally, it complicates the codebase, making it difficult to navigate and understand the projectâ€™s dependency graph.
This rule ignores .d.ts files and type-only exports.
For a more detailed explanation, check outhttps://marvinh.dev/blog/speeding-up-javascript-ecosystem-part-7/
noBarrelFile.option: This rule has no specific options.
